articles.title: No court pause on Sambhal mosque demolition, plea says can trigger riots
articles.excerpt: The Allahabad High Court on Saturday refused to stay the demolition of a mosque and an adjacent marriage hall and a hospital allegedly built on government land in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. Dismissing the petition, a single judge bench of Justice Dinesh Pathak directed the mosque committee to file an appeal before the trial court against the demolition order. The petition was filed by Masjid Sharif Gausul Wara Rawa Buzurg and its mutawalli (caretaker), Minjar.

articles.title: Coast Guard Akshar commissioned at Karaikal, boosting India’s maritime strength
articles.excerpt: The Indian Coast Guard on Saturday commissioned its latest vessel, ICGS Akshar, at Karaikal, marking a significant boost to the country’s maritime security capabilities. The 51-metre fast patrol vessel (FPV) is the second in the indigenously built Adamya-class series. The ceremony was attended by Dipti Mohil Chawla, IDAS, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Defence, and Additional Director General Donny Michael, PTM, TM, Coast Guard Commander (Eastern Seaboard), along with senior officials from both central and state governments.

articles.title: New York’s Roosevelt Hotel May Make Way for New Skyscraper | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Pakistan is considering options for the Roosevelt Hotel in Midtown Manhattan as part of the South Asian nation’s efforts to meet its commitments to the International Monetary Fund. One of the options is to raze the storied landmark and build a skyscraper in its place, said Muhammad Ali, adviser to the prime minister on privatization. The government is keen on a joint venture where Pakistan will contribute the land and the partner will bring in the equity, he told Bloomberg in Islamabad.

articles.title: Iran executes seven over killings of security forces, cleric
articles.excerpt: Iran on Saturday executed seven men convicted of killing security personnel and a cleric several years ago, the judiciary’s news agency Mizan reported. Six of the men were ethnic Arab separatists accused of carrying out armed attacks and bombings in Khorramshahr, in the southwestern province of Khuzestan, that killed four security forces. The seventh, Saman Mohammadi Khiyareh, a Kurd, was convicted over the 2009 assassination of Mamousta Sheikh al-Islam, a pro-government Sunni cleric in the Kurdish city of Sanandaj.

articles.title: 7 youths injured in knife attack during Durga idol immersion in Jharkhand
articles.excerpt: Seven youths were injured, one of them critically, in a stabbing incident during a Durga idol immersion ceremony in Jharkhand. The incident happened on Friday night when a group of youths from the Harijan Basti area in Chakradharpur were returning after immersing the idol of their Durga Puja pandal. As they were returning, a group of 15 assailants entered the procession and went on a stabbing spree.

Get features like Union education ministry’s higher education department on Friday directed all officials to adopt the Zoho Office Suite for official work, a ‘bold’ move aimed at ‘strengthening digital sovereignty under the Swadeshi movement towards Atmanirbhar Bharat’, according to an official document. In an office memorandum, Nishant Upadhyaya, under secretary of higher education said that the directive aligns with the government’s vision of transforming the country from a service economy into a product nation and building a self-reliant ecosystem in technology, hardware, and software. Officials are now required to use Zoho tools — already integrated with the NIC mail system — for creating, editing, and sharing documents, spreadsheets, and presentations, he said..

articles.title: BJP, Shinde Sena and Uddhav Thackeray spar over ‘fake Hindutva’ ahead of Mumbai civic polls
articles.excerpt: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray’s recent Dussehra rally speech, in which he accused the BJP of promoting “fake Hindutva” and questioned its commitment to Hindu values, has triggered a sharp political exchange ahead of the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections. Thackeray’s remarks, which targeted the BJP’s “contradictory” stance on Hindu-Muslim issues and its alliance with the Eknath Shinde-led faction, drew quick responses from leaders of the ruling alliance. BJP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule hit back at Thackeray, criticising him for aligning with the Congress party which, he claimed, “insults Veer Savarkar.” He questioned why Thackeray refrained from criticising the Congress during his Dussehra speech, saying the former chief minister had “abandoned his father’s ideology by sitting in the lap of Congress.”.

articles.title: 15, including senior cop, injured in clashes during Bhasna festival in Cuttack

Tensions first ignited during the Bhasna procession organised by the Jhanjirimangala Puja Samiti. Eyewitnesses reported that two rival groups began hurling stones and glass bottles at each other, prompting immediate intervention by the police.

articles.title: The Big AI Trade in Europe Is All About Data Centers and Power | Mint
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- As the artificial intelligence frenzy drives global equities to record highs, in Europe the momentum is flowing into industries critical to powering the technology. A basket tracking shares of 10 European firms such as data center operators and infrastructure providers has rallied 23% this year, beating a 12% advance in the Stoxx Europe 600 Index and even outperforming the Nasdaq 100, home to the US tech heavyweights. While that’s a far cry from the 69% boom in US power stocks, investors including BlackRock Inc., JPMorgan Asset Management and Ninety One Plc are betting the European names can close the gap as they benefit from hundreds of billions of dollars in global AI spending..

articles.title: WhatsApp may soon add @username handles, moving beyond phone numbers | Mint
articles.excerpt: WhatsApp is reportedly preparing to introduce a long-anticipated update that will allow users to create usernames, moving away from its long-standing reliance on phone numbers. Since its launch in 2009, the Meta-owned messaging platform has only enabled registration and contact discovery through mobile numbers, a system that has increasingly looked dated compared with competitors such as Telegram, which has offered usernames for years. The upcoming feature has been spotted in recent test builds of the app, where references to usernames and their rules were uncovered.

articles.title: Israel strikes kill 6 in Gaza hours after Trump calls for end to bombardment
articles.excerpt: Israel carried out fresh strikes in Gaza on Saturday, killing six people just hours after US President Donald Trump directed an end to the bombardment and announced that Hamas was ready for peace. According to local authorities, one Israeli strike hit a house in Gaza City, killing four people, while another strike in Khan Younis, in southern Gaza, killed two others. The attacks came shortly after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office said Israel was preparing for an “immediate implementation” of the first stage of Trump’s Gaza plan, which involves the release of Israeli hostages following Hamas’ response.

articles.title: Man killed in blast while making crude bomb in West Bengal's Murshidabad
articles.excerpt: A man was killed in an explosion in Murshidabad district of West Bengal on Saturday morning while allegedly making a crude bomb. The incident occurred in the Chetiani area under Raninagar police station limits, where the victim, identified as Usman Biswas, died on the spot. Police said the blast triggered panic in the locality, prompting an immediate response from Raninagar police, who recovered several crude bombs from the site.

articles.title: India my matrubhumi: Ex-Pak cricketer Danish Kaneria's big claim on citizenship
articles.excerpt: Former Pakistani cricketer Danish Kaneria has clarified that he has no plans to seek Indian citizenship at present, rejecting rumours that his positive remarks on India's internal affairs were driven by such motives. The former leg break bowler, who is a Hindu, underscored that, despite facing "deep discrimination" from Pakistani authorities and the cricket board, Pakistan was his "janmabhoomi". "Lately, I have seen many people questioning me, asking why I do not speak about Pakistan, why I comment on Bharat's internal matters, and some even alleging that I do all this for Bharatiya citizenship.

articles.title: Karur stampede: Police to seize actor Vijay's campaign bus used during incident
articles.excerpt: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) constituted by the Madras High Court will seize the bus used by actor and Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK) founder Vijay during his September 27 political rally in Karur, Tamil Nadu, which left 41 people dead and more than 60 injured, sources told India Today TV. All CCTV footage from inside and around the bus, as well as from the site of the accident, will also be collected as part of the investigation. The SIT will be headed by Asra Garg, Inspector General of Police, North Zone, and will include IPS officers Vimala, Superintendent of Police, Namakkal, and Shyamaladevi, Superintendent of Police, CSCID..

articles.title: India Adds Nearly 17 Crore Jobs In 6 Years As Govt Doubles Down On Youth-Centric Policies

articles.title: What Is Diethylene Glycol, Highly Toxic Chemical Found In 'Coldrif' Syrup In Tamil Nadu?
articles.excerpt: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday banned the sale of the ‘Coldrif’ cough syrup and ordered its removal from all markets after it was linked to the deaths of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. Lab tests found the syrup contained diethylene glycol (DEG), a deadly chemical that can cause kidney failure and death. The sale was prohibited across the state with effect from October 1, as inspections were conducted at the Tamil Nadu-based Sresan Pharma’s manufacturing facility in Sunguvarchathram.

articles.title: 3 women, out on morning walk, killed after car crushes them in UP; driver flees
articles.excerpt: Three women were killed, and a man was seriously injured after a speeding car hit them during their morning walk in Ghaziabad today. According to police, the incident took place around 6 am near the Rakesh Marg cut on GT Road, where an over-speeding car rammed into four morning walkers. The victims have been identified as Vipin Sharma (47), a resident of Shtam Vihar Colony, and Meenu Prajapati (56), Kamlesh (55), and Savitri Devi (60), all residents of New Kotgaon in the Kotwali area..

articles.title: Multidisciplinary Team Probing To Assess Cause Of Cough Syrup Deaths In MP, Rajasthan: Govt
articles.excerpt: A probe undertaken by the Tamil Nadu FDA at the behest of the MP government, it was found that the cough syrups contained DEG beyond the permissible limits. Trending Photos NEW DELHI: After detecting highly toxic chemical diethylene glycol (DEG) in samples of cough syrups manufactured by Tamil Nadu-based drug manufacturer, the Union government has informed that a multidisciplinary team comprising experts from central agencies such as NIV, ICMR, and CDSCO are probing to assess the cause of deaths in children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. About nine children have in recent weeks succumbed to death in MP's Chhindwara, and two children died in Rajasthan -- one in Bharatpur and another in Sikar after consuming counterfeit cough syrup in Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh due to suspected kidney failure.

articles.title: 63-Year-Old Lawyer In Mumbai Blackmailed With Nude Video After Spa Visit, Loses Rs 50,000
articles.excerpt: A 63-year-old lawyer in Mumbai’s Borivali was allegedly blackmailed and assaulted by two men who filmed him in a compromising position during a massage session. The accused, who posed as masseurs, initially extorted Rs 50,000 and later demanded an additional Rs 6 lakh, police said on Friday. According to investigators, the incident came to light when the complainant, a lawyer who had recently purchased a vacant flat in Borivali, searched for a massage service through an online Yellow Pages directory in July this year.

articles.title: Pakistan High Commission Visa Desk In Delhi Misused As ISI Recruitment Hub | Exclusive
articles.excerpt: Top intelligence sources have exclusively confirmed to CNN-News18 that the Visa Section of the Pakistan High Commission (PHC) in New Delhi is being systematically misused as a hub for espionage, functioning as a “soft entry point" to identify, recruit, and groom vulnerable Indian nationals for intelligence work. The latest confirmation of this modus operandi comes with the September 30 arrest of Waseem Akram, a civil engineer from Palwal, under the Official Secrets Act (OSA) and the new Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS). Akram was acting as a courier and data supplier for PHC official Jaffar, alias Muzammil Hussain.

articles.title: How A Delhi Woman Saved Rs 93 Lakh Under Section 54F Despite Not Getting House On Time
articles.excerpt: Rajni had sold a capital asset for Rs 1.25 crore. After adjusting indexed costs and transfer expenses of Rs 32.42 lakh, her long-term capital gain (LTCG) came to Rs 92.57 lakh. Then she used the proceeds to build a residential property through multiple payments in 2016.

articles.title: Flash flood alert in Bihar after four days of relentless rainfall
articles.excerpt: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a flash flood alert for several districts in Bihar for today and tomorrow, following four consecutive days of incessant rainfall that has severely disrupted normal life across the state. The districts under the flash flood alert include - Patna, Bhabua, Arwal, Bhojpur, Buxar, Rohtas, Saran, Siwan, Araria, Banka, Begusarai, Bhagalpur, Darbhanga, Gaya, Jamui, Khagaria, Lakhisarai, Madhepura, Madhubani, Munger, Nawada, West Champaran, East Champaran, Purnia, Saharsa, Samastipur, Shivhar, Sitamarhi, and Vaishali. According to reports from Sasaram, relentless rain from late Friday night until 3 am Saturday has submerged the entire city and surrounding areas.

articles.title: Gujarat ATS seizes ₹30 crore Mephedrone in Daman; one arrested, two absconding
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like Ahmedabad: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) and Daman police arrested a history-sheeter and seized 5.9 kg of mephedrone worth ₹30 crore after raiding a clandestine factory in Daman, a Union Territory, and a storage facility in Gujarat’s Vapi, police said on Friday. Mohan Narayanlal Paliwal, a known offender, was arrested during Thursday’s raid, while two others — Mehul Thakur and Vivek Balendra Rai — remain at large, a police officer said, adding that all three are residents of Vapi in Valsad district. “During the raid, authorities disrupted an active mephedrone production process at the Daman farmhouse, seizing 5.9 kg of mephedrone in solid and liquid forms from the Vapi bungalow, along with 300 kg of raw materials and equipment like grinders, motors, glass flasks, and heaters,” an officer said..

articles.excerpt: National Security Adviser (NSA) Ajit Doval on Friday met Special Adviser to the President of Brazil, Ambassador Celso Luis Nunes Amorim, in New Delhi for the 6th India-Brazil Strategic Dialogue. Ambassador Amorim was accompanied by a delegation of senior Brazilian officials and advisors. According to a statement from the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), the dialogue provided "an opportunity to follow up on the issues identified under five pillars of cooperation during the State Visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Brazil in July 2025".

articles.title: Trouble brewing: Maya people in Yucatán fear new Heineken plant’s thirst for water
articles.excerpt: Indigenous groups in Mexico opposed to the planned brewery say families already have little access to water – and that their way of life is also under threat On a summer evening in southern Mexico, a percussion group using water bottles as instruments leads a procession through Mérida, capital of Yucatán state. Children walking alongside elderly people are guided by members of Múuch’ Xíinbal, a Maya land rights organisation. The placards they carry declare: “Water is not for sale.” A heavy chant accompanies the march: “It’s not a drought – it’s plunder!” At a rallying point in the city, protesters read from a manifesto and accuse the government of prioritising profit over water, health and land.

articles.excerpt: Cybercriminals linked to a wave of ransomware incidents targeting British retailers have claimed responsibility for stealing almost one billion records from US cloud technology giant Salesforce. The group, calling itself Scattered LAPSUS$ Hunters, told Reuters on Friday that it had obtained vast troves of personal information by exploiting companies that rely on Salesforce software. The group, an apparent offshoot of the wider LAPSUS$ cybercrime network, said it was behind recent breaches at Marks & Spencer, the Co-op and Jaguar Land Rover earlier this year.

articles.title: Cyclone Shakhti: Who Named The Storm, And How It May Affect Gujarat And Maharashtra
articles.excerpt: The country’s weather scenario is set to worsen as the first cyclonic storm in the post-monsoon season, Cyclone Shakhti, has intensified over the Arabian Sea. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has confirmed that the cyclone, which originated in the northeast Arabian Sea, has strengthened into a severe cyclonic storm, prompting coastal regions to brace for heavy rainfall and strong winds. According to the IMD, Cyclone Shakhti is currently situated approximately 270 km southwest of Naliya in Gujarat, 300 km west of Porbandar, and 360 km south of Karachi, Pakistan.

articles.title: 2-Wheeler Sales Rise 9 Per Cent In September On GST Cut, Festive Demand
articles.excerpt: The domestic two-wheeler sales rose 6% YoY and 18% month-on-month (MoM), supported by strong performances from Royal Enfield (43% YoY), Suzuki Motorcycle (37% YoY), and TVS Motor (12% YoY). Trending Photos New Delhi: India’s two-wheeler manufacturers registered a 9 per cent year-on-year (YoY) increase in September dispatches, crossing the two-million mark, buoyed by festive season demand following a cut in Goods and Services Tax (GST). The government reduced the tax on motorcycles up to 350 cc to 18 per cent.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu Regulator Warns Against Use Of Coldrif Syrup After Lab Detects Deadly Diethylene Glycol
articles.excerpt: The Tamil Nadu Drugs Control Department has issued a public alert warning against the use of Coldrif Syrup manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, after laboratory tests confirmed that the product was adulterated with diethylene glycol (DEG)—a highly toxic chemical known to cause kidney failure and death. The alert follows investigations into the deaths of around 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan, which were initially suspected to be linked to the consumption of the same cough syrup. On October 4, the Union health ministry also confirmed that samples of Coldrif Syrup collected from the manufacturer’s premises in Tamil Nadu contained DEG beyond permissible limits.

articles.title: New York’s Roosevelt Hotel May Make Way for New Skyscraper
articles.excerpt: Source: Plexi Images/Universal Images Group Editorial/Getty Images Pakistan is considering options for the Roosevelt Hotel in Midtown Manhattan as part of the South Asian nation’s efforts to meet its commitments to the International Monetary Fund. One of the options is to raze the storied landmark and build a skyscraper in its place, said Muhammad Ali, adviser to the prime minister on privatization. The government is keen on a joint venture where Pakistan will contribute the land and the partner will bring in the equity, he told Bloomberg in Islamabad..

articles.title: Trump officials cut nearly $8bn in clean energy projects in Democratic states
articles.excerpt: Democrats and environmental groups slam move as ‘sick political game’ and say it will drive up energy bills The Trump administration is cancelling $7.6bn in grants that supported hundreds of clean energy projects in 16 states, all of which voted for Democrat Kamala Harris in last year’s presidential election. The move comes as Donald Trump threatens deep cuts in his fight with congressional Democrats over the government shutdown. The energy department said in a statement on Thursday that 223 projects were terminated after a review determined they did not adequately advance the nation’s energy needs or were not economically viable.

articles.title: First Automobile Freight Train Successfully Arrives In Kashmir

articles.title: IMF Says Talks on New Senegal Program Will Start Mid-October
articles.excerpt: Downtown Dakar, Senegal. The International Monetary Fund will begin talks with Senegal on a new program in mid-October, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said following a board meeting on the country’s debt misreporting. The meeting, a key step in concluding a nearly year-long review of the West African nation’s finances, follows initial discussions on the broad framework of a new program held with Senegalese authorities in Dakar in August, Georgieva said in a statement late Friday..

articles.title: Perplexity’s $200 Comet Browser Now Free, CEO Aravind Srinivas Takes Dig At Chrome
articles.excerpt: Perplexity AI has made its Comet browser freely available to all users, eliminating the previous $200-per-month (around Rs 17,000) paywall that restricted access to its advanced features. The announcement was made by CEO Aravind Srinivas on X (formerly Twitter) on October 2, where he also took a playful dig at Google Chrome. Resharing a post from one X user, he wrote, “O hey hi @googlechrome." Check the post here: o hey hi @googlechrome https://t.co/rpkg6JCxMJ— Aravind Srinivas (@AravSrinivas) October 2, 2025 Until now, Comet was available exclusively to Pro and Max subscribers, meaning free users were unable to access its AI-powered tools and some of its most advanced features.

Shakhti is the first cyclonic storm after the monsoon season in the Arabian Sea. Several areas in Maharashtra, including Mumbai, Thane, Palghar, Raigad, Ratnagiri, and Sindhudurg, are expected to witness heavy rain.

articles.title: Markets In UP's Bahraich See Unusual Rush For Torches. Here's Why
articles.excerpt: Markets across the Uttar Pradesh’s Bahraich district are witnessing an unexpected surge in torch sales, with shopkeepers reporting long queues for devices that went largely unnoticed just days ago. The rising demand has also brought torch repairers into the spotlight, as residents rush to replace batteries, lights, and switches, boosting their daily earnings. This sudden spike in demand is being attributed to a series of thefts reported in villages, neighbourhoods, and city areas over the past several days.

articles.title: October 4, 1977: 48 Years On, Atal Bihari Vajpayee's First Hindi Speech At UN Still Revered
articles.excerpt: The corridors of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), long dominated by English and French, reverberated with Hindi for the very first time on this day in 1977. The voice was that of Atal Bihari Vajpayee, then External Affairs Minister in the Morarji Desai-led Janata Party government, who later went on to become the Prime Minister. His speech, delivered in Hindi at the 32nd session of the UN General Assembly on October 4, 1977, not only set a precedent but also showcased India’s cultural confidence before the world.

articles.title: Centre Confirms DEG Contamination In Madhya Pradesh Cough Syrup Samples Amid Probe Into Child Deaths
articles.excerpt: The Union government has confirmed the presence of diethylene glycol (DEG) much beyond permissible limits in cough syrup samples manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, marking a sharp shift from its statement a day before that no DEG was found in syrups linked to child deaths in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan. News18 first reported the sharp contrast between the results of Tamil Nadu’s drug regulator finding toxic DEG in samples while the Centre refused the presence of any harmful contaminants in the syrups. According to a press note shared by the Union ministry of health and family welfare on Saturday morning, the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) tested six syrup samples collected as part of the probe, and all six were found to be free of DEG/EG.

It also mentions that Nirav Modi will be housed in Arthur Road prison in Mumbai where living conditions for inmates are better.

articles.excerpt: A middle-class man in Rajkot, Gujarat, fell victim to a fraud worth Rs 8.85 lakh by an individual who promised to secure his loan approvals. According to the Times of India, after receiving loan approval messages via WhatsApp, the man transferred Rs 9.35 lakh to the fraudster’s bank account as a processing fee and login charge. He later realised he had been cheated when no loan amount was disbursed, and he only received a refund of Rs 50,000.

The incident occurred when the lift, stuck between the third and fourth floors, failed to open, leaving the child trapped. According to the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation’s fire department, they received an emergency call about the child being trapped in the lift.

articles.title: 'They Walked Away': Madras High Court Tears Into TVK, Its Chief Vijay Over Karur Stampede
articles.excerpt: The Madras High Court on Friday expressed grief over the Karur stampede, which claimed the lives of 41 people on September 27, and pulled up the Tamilaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK) leaders and organisers of the rally by actor-turned-politician Vijay. The court bashed the party leaders and organisers for their failure to rescue the public and children, and for not taking responsibility for the incident. “Watching the videos is painful," said Justice N Senthilkumar, as the court expressed shock that only two people had been arrested so far in connection with the incident.

articles.title: Tata Capital vs LG Electronics: Confused Between Two Big IPOs? Compare GMP, Price, More
articles.excerpt: Tata Capital vs LG Electronics IPOs: The primary market is set to witness the biggest battle of 2025 next week when two bellwether IPOs (Initial Public Offerings) are poised to compete in an already saturated field. Launching in a gap of a day, two IPOs raising a cumulative amount of Rs 27,000 crore will open their three-day subscription windows between Monday, October 06, and Thursday, October 09, 2025. In the ensuing heated battle, investors are facing a dilemma where they should put their limited investment fund – Tata Capital, which is part of the Tata Group, or LG Electronics India, an Indian arm of the South Korean multinational corporation.

articles.title: Online Debate Over Cyclone Shakhti’s Name Stirs Confusion Amid Alert In Maharashtra
articles.excerpt: As Cyclone Shakhti brews over the north Indian Ocean, its very name has sparked a wave of confusion among weather watchers and social media users alike. What’s the reason? Just a few months ago, in May 2025, online platforms were flooded with alarming posts about an approaching “Cyclone Shakti." The warnings spread fast, fuelling panic in coastal states. But the India Meteorological Department (IMD) quickly stepped in to clarify that there was no cyclone at all—only an upper-air circulation that never developed into a storm.

articles.title: Srinagar Police Attach Property Worth Rs 2 Crore Linked To Pahalgam Mastermind
articles.excerpt: Srinagar Police have attached a three-storey residential house valued at approximately Rs 2 crore, linked to designated terrorist Sajad Ahmad Sheikh aka Sajjad Gul, the mastermind of the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, as part of its goal to dismantle terror networks and their support structures, according to an official release. Police attached the property that was constructed over 15 marlas of land under Survey No. 43, Estate Khushipora, in Rose Avenue of Srinagar’s HMT area.

articles.title: SEBI’s UPI Verification Tools: A Step Towards Scam-Free Investing
articles.excerpt: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has launched two new measures designed to improve the safety of digital transactions for investors. Named “Validated UPI Handles" and “SEBI Check," these tools are intended to curb fraud by ensuring that fund transfers occur only through verified intermediaries registered with SEBI, such as brokers and mutual funds. SEBI had initially announced these initiatives in a press release and circular issued in June this year.

articles.title: 7 benefits of fiber-rich foods for digestion and heart - Improves Digestion
articles.excerpt: Fiber adds bulk to your stool, preventing constipation and promoting smooth bowel movements, keeping your digestive system healthy and functioning efficiently. Soluble fiber binds to cholesterol in the digestive tract, helping lower LDL (“bad”) cholesterol and supporting overall heart health. Fiber slows down sugar absorption, preventing sudden spikes in blood glucose levels and reducing the risk of type 2 diabetes..

articles.title: Sam Altman announces big changes for Sora: More control for creators, monetisation on the way | Mint
articles.excerpt: OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman announced some crucial changes for Sora, the company’s experimental video-generation tool, on Saturday after receiving extensive feedback from users, creators, and rights holders. In a blog post, Altman confirmed that Sora will soon introduce more detailed options for rights holders to decide how their characters are used within the platform. The system will build on the existing opt-in model for likeness but offer additional layers of control, including the ability to block or restrict certain uses altogether.

articles.title: Malaysia’s Weststar Secures $309 Million Funding for Expansion
articles.excerpt: Malaysia’s financial services firm MBSB Bhd will provide MYR1.3 billion ($309 million) in funding to support the expansion of Weststar Aviation Services Sdn Bhd, the aviation arm of The Weststar Group, the Edge newspaper reported Friday, citing a statement. The financing, arranged through a syndicated Islamic facility, will be used to buy helicopters, fund working capital and cover other corporate purposes, including foreign-exchange management, according to the report. MBSB’s banking unit is acting as a joint lead arranger for the loan, it said..

articles.excerpt: The EU and UK have imposed mandates, and investors see its value – but the industry has mixed views One hundred years ago, the Italian aviator Francesco de Pinedo was attempting the unprecedented feat of crossing the Indian subcontinent in a flying boat. He later splashed down on the Tiber in Rome to national acclaim, having flown via Asia to Australia and back over seven months, taking off and landing in water 80 times. Aviation has been marked by stop-start journeys on hitherto uncharted courses to unlikely, if not unreachable, destinations.

articles.title: US shutdown drags on as funding vote fails again, hopes for quick deal fade
articles.excerpt: The US government shutdown entered its third day on Friday after the Senate failed to advance a funding bill, with Democrats demanding health care subsidies and President Donald Trump preparing sweeping federal cuts. On the Senate floor, a Republican-backed funding bill failed 54-44, falling short of the 60 votes needed to overcome a filibuster. Lawmakers promptly headed for the exits, signaling no weekend votes and little appetite for compromise, the Associated Press reported.

articles.excerpt: VAT on school fees has led to a rise in overseas interest and even relocations as UK fees have jumped by as much as 22.6% Wealthy British parents are turning to boarding schools in continental Europe as rising private school fees push families to look for cheaper options abroad. German and Swiss institutions have reported rises in the number of queries from British parents who face higher fees at home, after the Labour government imposed 20% VAT on private education from January. Jamie Perfect, the director of the International School of Bremen in northern Germany, said the school had been “inundated” with requests.

articles.title: US treasury considers $1 coin featuring Trump for America’s 250th anniversary
articles.excerpt: The US Treasury is considering making a $1 coin featuring President Donald Trump to commemorate 250 years since the declaration of American independence in 2026, it said on Friday. Images of the potential design showed Trump holding a raised clenched fist on one side of the coin alongside the words "fight, fight, fight" - a reference to what he said immediately after surviving an assassination attempt last year. The other side of the coin shows Trump in profile with the word "liberty" above him and "1776-2026" written below, according to images shared by Treasurer Brandon Beach on X..

articles.title: Why Korea Is Becoming the New Japan
articles.excerpt: South Korea President Lee Jae Myung. Last year, Korea announced its “Corporate Value Up” program, similar to what Japan has done. Thirty five years and five months.
articles.content_snippet: South Korea President Lee Jae Myung. Last year, Korea announced its “Corporate Value Up” program, similar to what Japan has done. Thirty five years and five months. That’s how long it took Japan’s Topix index to hit a new high and finally mark the end of the longest bear market in history. If you’d invested at the bottom, you’d be up 400% (at its worst the index was 80% off its highs). But even if you’d paid attention to value obsessives like me in 2023, you’d be up 65% by now. articles.title: Rachel Reeves urged to break manifesto pledges to avoid ‘pasty tax’ budget
articles.excerpt: Labour colleagues advise chancellor against string of small money-raising measures, as OBR presents forecast Some of Rachel Reeves’s Labour colleagues have urged her to ditch the party’s manifesto promises rather than risk a “pasty tax” budget that raises money through a string of small measures. As the independent Office for Budget Responsibility (OBR) presented its first fiscal forecast to the Treasury on Friday, several sources said there was tension within the government over the manifesto pledges. Labour’s manifesto before returning to power last year included a promise not to raise national insurance, VAT or income tax, which between them account for about 75% of tax revenue.

articles.title: ‘One rule for the rich’: the Salzburg mansion, the Porsche heir and the writer Stefan Zweig
articles.excerpt: The car magnate, who is restoring the Jewish author’s former villa, has been given permission to dig out a 500-metre road leading to a garage, causing consternation in the city For three years the peace and quiet of Doris Rüggeberg’s cosy flat on the Kapuzinerberg, a picturesque wooded hill in Salzburg, has been interrupted by the noise from the nextdoor neighbour’s building site. Wolfgang Porsche, a German-Austrian automotive magnate, bought the 17th-century villa at No 5 as a second home in 2019 for about €9m (£7.8m). Ever since, he has been busily renovating the property before he and his partner, Gabriele Prinzessin zu Leiningen, move in this winter.

articles.title: UK electric car sales hit record high as taxpayer subsidies help attract buyers
articles.excerpt: EVs rise nearly a third in September compared with a year earlier, as plug-in hybrids jump by 56% British electric car sales hit a record high in September as new taxpayer subsidies helped to attract buyers in the most important month for the market. Battery EV sales rose by nearly a third in September compared with a year earlier, to 72,800, according to preliminary figures from the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT), a lobby group. The UK government reintroduced an electric car grant in July after intense lobbying by carmakers who argued that they were struggling to meet targets on electric sales, known as the zero emission vehicle (ZEV) mandate.

articles.title: Universal to reopen Stardust Racers ride two weeks after mans death | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — Universal Orlando Resort plans to reopen its Stardust Racers ride at Epic Universe more than two weeks after a 32-year-old man died of blunt force injuries after going on the high-speed roller coaster. Signs will be updated to reinforce existing warnings and eligibility requirements to help visitors decide if they should go on the dual-launch coaster, which reaches speeds up to 62 mph (100 kph), Karen Irwin, president and chief operating officer at Universal Orlando Resort, said Friday in a memo to workers.

articles.title: Apple removes ICE tracking apps after US government pressure
articles.excerpt: Apple AAPL.O said on Thursday that it had removed ICEBlock and other similar ICE-tracking apps from its App Store after it was contacted by President Donald Trump's administration, in a rare instance of apps being taken down due to a US federal government demand. Alphabet's Google GOOGL.O also removed similar apps on Thursday for policy violations, but the company said it was not approached by the Justice Department before taking the action. The app alerts users to Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in their area, which the Justice Department says could increase the risk of assault on US agents..

articles.title: Tricolor Trustee Says Initial Probes Suggest ‘Pervasive’ Fraud | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- The trustee overseeing bankrupt Tricolor Holdings is investigating possible wrongdoing by the subprime auto lender before its collapse in order to raise money to pay creditors, a lawyer said in court Friday. The company’s business “appears to be a pervasive fraud of rather extraordinary proportion,” Charles R. Gibbs, who is representing the trustee, told the judge overseeing the company’s liquidation.

articles.title: Denmark warns of repeated Russian naval incursions in its straits
articles.excerpt: Danish defence intelligence announced Friday that Russian warships have conducted a series of confrontational acts targeting Danish naval ships and military aircraft in the narrow straits connecting the Baltic and North Seas. Danish Defence Intelligence Service reports describe Russian vessels steering directly toward Danish units, aiming weapons at ships and helicopters, and causing interruptions to navigational systems. Authorities note that such moves heighten the possibility of accidental clashes in an area already under strain since Russia's 2022 incursion into Ukraine.
